the next spot on this list is 2019's
musical drama yellow rose with
filipino-american film director diane
paragus at the helm this film follows
rose played by eva noblazada a filipina
illegal immigrant teenager who has
dreams of leaving her small town in
texas to become a country music singer
but when her mother played by princess
penzalen is detained by immigration rose
is forced to flee the scene and she
embarks on a journey of self-discovery
while searching for a new home in the
honky tonk world of austin texas the
film which dianne peragas had been
working on since 2004 also stars leia
salonga and dale watson and premiered at
the los angeles asian pacific film
festival in may of 2019. it went on to
win 13 film festival awards mostly in
recognition for august directing and the
performances by noglazada and salonga
also receiving a lot of love was the
soundtrack for this musical film which
features singing from paragus as well as
noblezada salanga and dale watson

and after delay thanks to kobit 19 the
film eventually hit theaters in october
of 2020 becoming one of the first
filipino american films to be released
by a major hollywood studio for
theatrical release and with a certified
fresh score on the tomato meter the
response from critics was positive like
the ap's jake coyle who said that this
movie sings an affecting sorrowful and
defiant song where dreams collide with a
cruel reality and the overall consensus
from critics called yellow rose a
coming-of-age story with a timely twist
offering a fresh and sweetly rewarding
perspective on the immigrant experience

the film focuses on wilhemina or will

little bit of a strain on will's

played by lynn chen alice wu originally

the future of the family if they don't
